description: Snap version just stopped see my ftp server. installed DEB version - everything is fine
summary: good app, easy to use. recommend DEB version

description:
As Tony Montuori already wrote: Google-coercion, this is misplaced for Linux. Kickit!
Version w/o constraints included in Ubuntu does its job.
summary: Déja dup - Backups wants to impose Google-account

description: Makes backups very easy

The version of deja-dup made available through snapcraft can only back up to or restore from Google Drive, which makes it singularly useless. My other computers, that don't use snap packages, can target a wide variety of remote services, but this snap package is so limited in scope that I cannot recommend it at all.
Echoing a previous poster... Destination targets are limited to Google Drive, Microsoft One Drive, network and local drives. I was hoping to back up to an S3 compatible service, but no love.
Doesn't work properly wtih smb, just getting "volume doesn’t implement mount" on steamOS
Simple GUI, encrypted backups, perfect.

It's an easy to understand GUI to the powerful rsync. Simplicity and reliability is what one wants in a backup application, and for a desktop or series of desktops in a SOHO type of environment, this is perfect.
Perfect! Simple GUI, easy to understand, very useful.
The configuration is easy. It uses your PGP key for file encryption.
Works just fine with a autofs-mounted smb share.

So far backing up works. I haven't tried restoring, but I hope that would work too. Only problem is with locked files in my profile like .mysql_history which throws error every backup and there is nothing I can do about it really.
Very simple to use, and the feature set is solid.
summary: The best backup app for most people

description: Don't use Google
"Official" apt package has problem with Python dependencies. This package works flawlessly.
Betrayed me once, cannot trust it any more.
Why remove the backend and why is a contriboter is not being stopped by Gnome making massive changes to application functionality
i never had a problem.. and i can use a pass key. great coding.
A bit slow sometimes and lacks an app indicator, but otherwise works just fine.

encrypted backup to cloud, USB etc
fast, reliable.
Great app, would recommend
For me on Unbuntu 19.10 it works fine. I have it setup to backup over to a Windows file share and it works without any issues.
Tried twice - Failed to restore twice. Apparently does not recognise it's own backup files. Need an alternate program to decode Duplicity difftar.gz.
Great app, would recommend
There is an error whenever I try to make a backup
Any software that refuses to uninstall should be considered crapware!
summary: Refuses to uninstall! I would not recommend it!

description: Snap issues are causing a fail to back up

Needs to be updated to work with 20.04 Getting error:

BackendException: Could not initialize backend: /snap/core18/current/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/librt.so.1: undefined symbol: __clock_nanosleep, version GLIBC_PRIVATE

I had used this to backup 18.04 when my system crashed I installed a fresh copy of 20.04 thinking I could easily restore files. Unfortunately on a fresh "minimal" install of 20.04 the app wont allow me to restore files.  I had to resort to manually stitching the duplicity files together to get at a recent copy of my files.
summary: App wont run on a fresh 20.04 Install

description:
Loaded the new LTS Ububtu and when I try Backup it says:
BackendException: Could not initialize backend: /snap/core18/current/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/librt.so.1: undefined symbol: __clock_nanosleep, version GLIBC_PRIVATE

and won't work.

The first thing this ridiculous program wanted from me was my Google account. 

Red Hat and Fedora you are normal, adult companies, right?
Can you in the 21st century make a tool that people can use to backup system? Thank you!
Do not trust it.

It was great in backup, but restoring it show an error:
Failed with an unknown error.
It used to be a "now you see me - now you don't" utility s/w. But the latest release (42) works flawless & restores everything with no problem

On Ubuntu installed this and tried to do back-up, which is what it claims to do. It can't do it. Replies with:- 
BackendException: PyDrive backend requires PyDrive installation. Please read the manpage for setup details.
Exception: No module named 'apiclient'
Some clever software engineer wrote that error message, but it means nothing to me. Website says to use -
pip something or other. not understood on command line so that's no good.
I sort of expected that installing the program would install backend, frontends, apiclients and all the rest so that it might actually do what it is supposed to. Or a helpful and understandable error message might be generated that let me know what I must do to sort it out. Telling me to read "manpage" whatever that is, and not telling me where i might find this "manpage" which holds all the secrets was pretty spectacularly unhelpful. Did no-one think of this before? Complete fail. Couple of hours of my life I won't get back. Doesn't work. Great app guys not.
Gobbles huge space in Google Drive,soon floods the drive with backups. Default six months hold before deletion of backups is far too long.

I try to backup to secondary drive and I get "deja vu this storage location is no longer available"

Google no help.

I had a disk full error and managed to write out a file with 0 bytes instead of the weeks of work it actually was. So my file was gone... 

Luckily there was my backup! But inconveniently this took hours because I had to dump the entire backup to a folder to get my one 86k file. there is NO WAY to restore a single file! You must restore the entire backup to get your one file! 

May I please request that a feature is added to be able to restore single files? Commercial backup software often has this, so why not deja-dup?
summary: It does backup but inconvenient to restore!

description:
After an upgrade the tool refuses to start reporting a missing libiff.so.
Fixed it by reistalling PyGObject to version 3.38.0).

This is a toy for small backups. When larger backup fails for any reason, DejaDup deletes already uploaded files and starts from scratch. There are lots of other issues with larger backups. Don't use it for cloud backups larger than about 10GB.
does take a while to parse through the files, but works as intended!
summary: easy to use, can restore folders quite easily

description: Works great!!!

With no explanation they stopped to support s3 - the most cost effective way to backup gigabites, it looks like google drive has paid them so clients like me forced to pay hundreds of dollars for google storage

I backup all my systems dutifully every week, and every time I have a system crash, I try to restore from Deja Dup. Every time, it fails or says no backups are found (in the folder where there are clearly backups). 

Really disappointing. Costs me so much time.
summary: Never once worked when I needed it

description: S3 is a basic service to support. No reason it shouldn't be an option.

I have been unable to restore files after a system upgrade and reinstall. I get this message. Command line help file procedure did not work either.

GPGError: GPG Failed, see log below:

gpg: AES256 encrypted data
gpg: encrypted with 1 passphrase
gpg: [don't know]: invalid packet (ctb=69)
gpg: [don't know]: partial length invalid for packet type 17
gpg: WARNING: message was not integrity protected
gpg: [don't know]: invalid packet (ctb=61)

Extremely annoying that you can't hide the progress bar, but workable

Used to love this App and have been away from Ubuntu for some time. Have started to use it again and find that the old features integrated into the File Manager is no longer present which is a shame as the ability to recover missing files and restore previous versions option was great.
summary: Good backup app but missing Files integration

description: Not user friendly. I am sat there trying to read my computers mind. Give us more dialog boxes so we know whats going on. Especially with encryption. Thank you.
summary: Have not been able to get it working yet

description:
I love its simplicity and it really works as advertised. It can be a truly setup and forget kinda deal! Tested on both Ubuntu and Fedora with the data stored on a NAS drive in my LAN with good results.
That said, Deja-Dup can be quite slow if you have thousands of small files backed up. Even restoring a few kbytes file can take up to several minutes, presumably because duplicity needs to go through the entire archive - split in hundreds of oddly-sized 25 Mb chunks with no visible way to change it - before doing anything and thus if speed is a concern, you should definitely look elsewhere.
And in true GNOME fashion, where removing features is seen as a "good thing", the developer inexplicably removed the --restore-missing feature on version 42.0 and up (in favor of a badly designed file browser) which is what broke Nautilus, Caja and Dolphin extensions everywhere so I've been forced to downgrade and pin the package to version 40 on Fedora as I consider that its killer feature and can't conceive how someone thought that removing it would be desirable...
summary: Love and hate it at the same time

description: Simple and easy to use!
Seemed to broken perpetually in Ubuntu, (personal experience) but has always been rock solid for me on GNU/Linux Debian.
summary: Working Great Installed from Debian Repo's

description: Cannot restore!
This program would hang and do nothing. Do not waste your time by installing it.
I don't know why everyone annoying and complaying about this application. As for me it's works fine and do its main function - simple backuping user's data.
summary: Nice and userfriendly interface, can backup to google drive

description: I was able to restore some deleted files. Not sure why it was giving me trouble earlier today. I tried again and was able to restore files that it previously would report as restored with no actual restored files. The only change was selecting an earlier date to restore.
this not suitable for whole system backups
I Would like You to add root permissions. This way we could make a full back up.
i LOVE THIS PROGRAM
Easy setup and doing the job
Works like a charm for two years already.

I'm using Deja-Dup to back-up my Home directory and personal files. 
Works very well and is tremendously practical. 

As explained above, this application is not for a full system (root) back-up. There are other back-up applications for that, that will give you restore points on your system. As those applications are not for personal back-ups, I use Dejau-Dup with one of those applications to get a full, sustainable system back-up.
please add the ability to have root privileged backups
summary: Excellent app missing one thing only

description: Have backups to restore and this doesn't even start on Ubuntu 21.10.

Make sure Backups has permission to run in the background in Settings → Applications → Backups and try again.

Well, it has.
Failed to restore from google drive
summary: Failed to restore from google drive

description: It would be nice if there was an ability to create a program recovery list aka "backup tool".
Cannot even backup on just keeps asking if I want to force quit or wait when using google drive. Brand new install of Ubuntu 20.04.3 LTS
summary: Hangs on Ubuntu and Google Drive

description: My favorit tool!

don't like google and don't use google. 
won't do back up unless I give it access to my google account. 

I have an external backup drive for a reason. Will have to switch to another program for doing my backups now.
It is a great app, but honestly it would be very nice to have multiple backup plans, not just a single one.
Only used for creating folders. I have using it for thr past 2 years
I have yet to test the backup but it works great over LAN, no issues with scheduled backs etc.
summary: works great backing up to a shared drive on my LAN

description: It's easy to understand, reliable and cool.

I connected an older 500 gig Maxstor external drive, however, no matter how many times I pick the folder on that drive as the destination Deja Dup defaults to the drive I originally picked and makes the folder there....

Anyone ever test their products as in "completely" before they hold them out to the public as a solution?

I mean I can't even figure out why Deja Dup doesn't list the drive, the local drive, as a location long before google and some other cloud drive. What is with the default drives assuming that people always want to store their information with "trusted" names like Google? No. Google isn't trusted, isn't to be assumed trusted, and the drive I have in my hot little hands that I can unplug and plug in at my discretion is trusted, genuinely trusted. Yeah really tired of coders trying to make these types of decisions, apparently inadvertently, when they set up a menu of choices.

I love the backup ability. I love that I can restore right from my thumb drive when my system has an issue. However, who died and left a coder to decide for me what drive I can use for backups or to impose my first choice as my only choice? No one. Fix it. And those who like making their own choices, avoid this product.
crash with long git names. big part backup gone. good for few files.
I was using it for 2 years, then I changed NAS storage and boom, encyption problems. Next I used Restic instead of Duplicity and it started to work again. 10/10 Linux experience

Ran great for a while until update to Ubuntu 21.x.

Does nothing now but generate errors with no instructions how to fix.
The app is very stable and works like a charm on my RHEL 8 system. I use it with the encryption options and remote storage to Google Drive.

I was on board with this right up to the point that the program tried to force me to log into a Google account. 

NOPE, No thank you. A MAJOR reason that I am a Linux user in the first place, is because I have grown to HATE companies like Microsoft, Google and Facebook. Big brother can take a hike.
summary: No Linux program should ever force a user to log into Google

description: Backs up without any problems. Recovery also successful.
Does what it should do and is simply to use.

description: yes I upload my files to clouds without using this app.
Works reliably, is fast, and just recently transfered all my files from one computer to new one with this.
Easy to use and it does what it has to do, as written
Works great, only thing is it works the first time on another partition of my HD but doesn't after that (unable to access the partition through the app)

description: Made me happy, this app is great
Been looking for a way to backup offsite and this is perfect. Quick, simple - no need to spend half a day learning command line parameters.
Great app and easy to restore backups.
summary: Does exactly what it is supposed to do

description: One of the best in Linux. Back up locally or to your Gmail account.

Bisher habe ich zwei mal eine Festplatte verloren, und beide Male hat mir Déjà Dup meinen Inhalt sauber zurückgegeben. Andererseits passiert es auch, dass das Backup beschädigt ist und man es komplett neu erzeugen muss; Deswegen und auch wegen der sehr geringen Einstellmöglichkeiten macht es einen etwas unfertigen Eindruck …
Wärend die Einbindung auf dem Desktop absolut grandios ist hatte ich immer wieder unverständliche Fehlermeldungen oder fehlgeschlagene Backups und dadurch eine gewisse Unsicherheit.
summary: Großartige Einbindung leider aber immer wieder Probleme mit gehabt

description: Das Standard Werkzeug bei Ubuntu. Erfüllt seinen Zweck und ist auch für Laien verständlich.
Das Programm ist total unbrauchbar. Hatte noch nicht mal die externe Festplatte als Sicherung akzeptiert. Hatte angeblich keine Berechtigung. Sorry totaler Müll.

Arbeite entspannt, denn das Programm ist super. Es hat mir schon ein paar Mal geholfen. Die Bedienung ist sehr einfach. Der Backup-Prozess dauert etwas, das könnte verbessert werden. Da ich dem Prozess aber nicht zuschauen will, ist es mir keinen Abzug wert.

Man kann sowohl damit komplette Backups wiederherstellen, z.B. nach einer Neuinstallation oder einzelne Ordner oder Dateien.
Nutze dieses Programm seit etlichen Jahren und hatte noch keine Datenverluste zu beklagen
summary: Tut was es soll und das zuverlässig

description: Ein Mal jdj fjsdakf dskvfkd avfds vfavfpda vjfeöbjfa ydlk

Verlasst Euch bloß nicht auf die Backups. Das Programm suggeriert, dass alles in Ordnung ist, das böse Erwachen kommt dann beim ersten Wiederherstellungsversuch. Für Euch getestet mit einem verschlüsselten Backup.
leider bietet das tool kein vollbackup..für mich so, völlig nutzlos, da alle einstellungen dann doch manuel nachgeholt werden müssen

Leider ist das Programm völlig ungeeignet (Kubuntu 20.04). Es konnte zwar ein Backup (mit Testdateien) durchführen, aber bei der Wieiderherstellung versagte es. Ergo Datenverlust, was absolut nicht akzeptabel ist.

Dieses Programm ist immer meine erste Wahl bei Backup-Programmen.
Es passt sich wunderbar zur GNOME-Shell und die Nautilus-Funktion finde ich auch super!
Aber es ist nicht nur etwas für GNOME-Benutzer, sondern auch für Leute die die Oberfläche aufgeräumt und modern haben wollen.
Ich empfehle es gerne weiter.
X mal komplett Home gesichert und X mal vollständig zurückgesichert. Funktioniert einwandfrei. Bei der richtigen Einstellung tägliche Sicherung möglich. Bestes Back Up Programm zumindest unter Gnome.

Ich habe versucht, damit ein Backup meiner Linux-Daten auf einer externen NTFS-Platte zu schreiben. Das tägliche Backup funktionierte wenn es hochkommt vier-, fünfmal. Dann gab es (bis zur Neueinrichtung) nur noch Fehlermeldungen.
In einem Fall wurde die Partition des Backup-Laufwerks beschädigt, so dass diese neu partitioniert werden musste (was das Schreiben eines Komplett-Backups meiner Windows-Daten bedeutet hat).
Also wenn man von Windows kommt, dann stellt man sich unter einer Backup-Lösung etwas anderes vor...
summary: Nicht geeignet für Dual-Boot mit Windows

description: Leider kann man keine einzelnen Dateien wiederherstellen (was das Back-end duplicity durchaus erlauben würde), da ist also noch ein bisschen Luft nach oben.

Ich habe es immer wieder versucht, Bei Testwiederherstellungen dann das böse Erwachen: Es funktioniert einfach nicht. Nach gut einem drittel eine Fehlermeldung dass dieses und jenes nicht gelesen werden kann und der komplette Vorgang wird abgebrochen. Hier wäre es Wünschenswert, wenn das Backup dennoch fortfährt und in einem Log festhält, welche Daten nicht wiederhergestellt werden können. 

Einzige brauchbare Funktion: Mit Nautilus Integration einzelne Dateien wiederherstellen. Dafür gibt's einen Stern.
summary: Noch nie eine erfolgreiche Wiederherstellung geschafft

description: It's almost perfect, I don't know any tool which can be configured to backup files to an SMB share this easy. I've also performed several full restores, but there are some corner cases where you might get errors (i.e. jumping to other Distributions with other versions of this app). I wish it had multiple profiles for different backup jobs, so i still need a second backup app for other backups on differens USB-HDDs. But otherwise I enjoy Deja-Dup and use it for years.
summary: Great and easy backuptool, but not 100% reliable

description:
Système de backup incrémental ne fonctionne pas.
Gestion malheureuse de NTFS.

Une excellente application qui vaut vraiment le détour, permettant de cloner de conserver et de restaurer les données d'un PC Ubuntu de manière simple et pratique sans se prendre la tête !
Il faudrait juste penser à préinstaller le module PyDrive car certaines personnes qui ne comprendraient pas ne pourraient pas faire le rapprochement avec Python, qui n'est absolument pas utilisé dans l'application originale Deja Dup (que je vous déconseille d'utiliser car elle n'est pas isolée)....
Pour les personnes qui se sont retrouvées dans cette galère et qui aimeraient en sortir, voici la commande à copier-coller dans un terminal administrateur pour installer le module manquant :
"pip3 install pydrive"
(pensez à installer le module pip3 s'il n'est pas déjà installé... "apt-get install pip3")
Ce logiciel est génial!!
Super logiciel pour faire des sauveagrdes facilement.
Bravo les champions du logiciel libre ...
summary: MDR 1ere fois que j'utilise ubuntu et il me damnde mon compte Google

description: rien a dire fait le job !
les dosiers ne se suppriment pas automatiquement, ce qui entraîne un remplissage rapide du disque dur.

Une catastrophe ! Vous passez des heures et des heures à essayer de récupérer vos datas cryptées pour finalement n'en retrouver qu'un quart … Mieux vaut tout simplement sauvegarder l'essentiel par transfert de dossier (sans app)
J'utilise cette app pour sauvegarde sur ssd externe, et pour stockage sur disque réseaux, fonctionne très bien.
fluide et simple pour des sauvegardes régulières

Risque de perte des données par restauration impossible dans certains cas.
Cette application est dangereuse car la sauvegarde se passe bien et on croit que nos données sont protégées. Quand j'ai testé la restauration au bout d'un an d'utilisation, seule celle du SSD a été restituée, celle du disque ne s'est pas faite (j'avais sauvegardé mes données courantes qui sont sur une partie de mon SSD, et mes archives sur une partie du disque dur). Donc faire des essais pour tester ce que cette application sait faire, et ce qu'elle ne fait pas. Et mes essais en ligne de commande de duplicity on indiqué des erreurs sans que je trouve la parade.
summary: Danger : la restauration ne fonctionne pas toujours

description:
Куда то делась коробочная поддержка Яндекса. Пишет не поддерживает https, хотя весь интернет забит советами использовать именно его. Пришлось в кривую - ставить демона YandexDisk и потом туда делать бекап. 
С таким же успехом я могу сделать что то типа 
rsync через tar... 
Через месяц поглядим, как он восстанавливает...
Пока впечатление не очень.

It makes really complex things simple and scheduled!

Deja-Dup is my favourite simple backup frontend for everyone. Using really powerfull console utulity it makes my data simply protected.
summary: It's a really userfriendly backup utility

description:
чтобы backup шел в облако, придется использовать диск яндекс, google drive работает криво. 
в автозапуск при старте 

#!/bin/bash
rm -drf ~/Yandex.Disk/backup-folder/*
(sleep 300 ; deja-dup --backup)
summary: Удобно, но нужно не много доработать

description: Стабильно, удобно, понятно, надёжно.
шняга еще та, для любителей
闪退，没法备份。欸可惜了，以前可是自带应用呢
